BiasBuster Privacy Policy

Last Updated: June 1, 2023

Welcome to BiasBuster ("we", "our", or "us"). We are committed to protecting your privacy and ensuring you have a positive experience when using our browser extension.

1. Information We Collect

BiasBuster collects the following information:

  • Article Content: When you use BiasBuster to analyze an article, we process the text content of the article you are viewing. This is necessary to provide our bias analysis service.
  • API Keys: If you choose to use your own API keys for third-party AI services (such as OpenAI, Anthropic, or Google), we store these keys in your browser's local storage. We do not transmit these keys to our servers.
  • Usage Statistics: We collect anonymous usage statistics, such as the number of articles analyzed and average bias scores. This data is used to improve our service and is not linked to your identity.

2. How We Use Your Information

We use the information we collect for the following purposes:

  • To provide and maintain our service
  • To analyze articles for bias and rewrite them to be more balanced
  • To improve and personalize your experience with BiasBuster
  • To develop new features and functionality

3. Third-Party Services

BiasBuster uses third-party AI services to analyze and rewrite articles. When you use these services through our extension:

  • Article content is sent to the selected AI service (OpenAI, Anthropic, or Google) for processing
  • Your use of these services is subject to their respective privacy policies
  • We do not share your personal information with these services beyond what is necessary to provide our functionality

4. Data Storage and Security

BiasBuster stores your settings and API keys locally in your browser using Chrome's storage API. This data remains on your device and is not transmitted to our servers. We implement appropriate security measures to protect your information.

5. Your Rights

You have the right to:

  • Access the personal information we have about you
  • Request that we correct or delete your personal information
  • Object to or restrict the processing of your personal information
  • Data portability (receiving your data in a structured, commonly used format)

6. Changes to This Privacy Policy

We may update our Privacy Policy from time to time. We will notify you of any changes by posting the new Privacy Policy on this page and updating the "Last Updated" date.

7. Contact Us

If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy, please contact us at:

Email: privacy@biasbuster.app
